Sir John Anderson,Go 0 c BoSir Frederick Liddell, K.C.BSir James Masterton 1 Smith, K.C.S,The Conference considered Sir F. Liddell's memorandum circulated by the Home Secretary - CP. 30 (23). It was agreed to recommend -(a) that no change should be made in the title of Parliament.(b) that in the first Consolidated Fund Bill words should be introduced to the effect that the Fund should in the future be called "The Consolidated Fund of the United Kingdom".(c) that in future Acts cf Parliament the use of the expression "United Kingdom" should be avoided where possible, the expressions "Great Britain and Ireland" or "Great Britain and northern Ireland" being used where one or the other is meant. .(d) that the preamble of the Army Act should be altered by striking cut the words "of Great Britain and Ireland" wherever they occur'..(e) that the expression "British Islands" chculd be avoided in Acts of Parliament.(f) that it should be expressly stated in all Bills whether or not they are to apply to Northern Ireland, It should ho assumed that an Act does not apply to the Iriph Free State where it is not expressly or by necessary implication so applied.W.O.E. 6.2.23
